item.title: MAP Growth Ohio Third Grade Reading Diagnostic
item.dc:creator: Tiffani LeClair
item.description:
Ohio’s Third Grade Reading Guarantee is a program to identify students from kindergarten through third grade that are behind in reading.Under this program, schools are required to administer a reading

The post MAP Growth Ohio Third Grade Reading Diagnostic appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
Ohio’s Third Grade Reading Guarantee is a program to identify students from kindergarten through third grade that are behind in reading.Under this program, schools are required to administer a reading diagnostic, also known as a screener, to all students in kindergarten through third grade each year to measure whether a student is on track.

The post MAP Growth Ohio Third Grade Reading Diagnostic appeared first on NWEA.

item.title: Research Brief: ESSA Summer Loss
item.dc:creator: Tiffani LeClair
item.description:
Research shows that estimates of school effectiveness are sensitive to seasonal patterns in student learning, particularly summer loss. In this research brief from the Collaborative for Student Growth, we share

The post Research Brief: ESSA Summer Loss appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
Research shows that estimates of school effectiveness are sensitive to seasonal patterns in student learning, particularly summer loss. In this research brief from the Collaborative for Student Growth, we share our findings on the extent that ignoring summer learning loss impacts school accountability determinations and whether we may be unfairly penalizing schools by not accounting for within-year growth.

Download the Research Brief

The post Research Brief: ESSA Summer Loss appeared first on NWEA.

item.title: 2017 Assessment Perceptions in Texas
item.dc:creator: Tiffani LeClair
item.description:
This study seeks to elevate the voices of parents and teachers to better discern their points of view about assessments in Texas today as they work together to drive better

The post 2017 Assessment Perceptions in Texas appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
This study seeks to elevate the voices of parents and teachers to better discern their points of view about assessments in Texas today as they work together to drive better learning for every student in their state.

The post 2017 Assessment Perceptions in Texas appeared first on NWEA.
